storyInfo: In the Grand Knight Territory, Margaret asks about the past after returning from a visit to her grandfather's grave. In the barrenlands, having said their goodbyes to their old friend, MÅ‚ynar and Toland discuss their future.

attributes.content: Marcin, how come this place feels so darn quiet lately?
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: You think? Maybe it only feels that way because you have one less person to talk to, now that Maria's no longer around.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Now that you mention it, I guess that might be it.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: I mean, at her age, should really should go out and see the world. It's just, who knows when she'll remember to come home for a visit?
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: You'd better get everything in your workshop in order then, old bones. When she finally gets back, you should hand her the keys.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Ah, it's been a while, my favorite customer.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Good afternoon, everybody.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Looks like the Radiant Knight can finally catch a breather?
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Everything is starting to move in the right direction, and I'm getting used to handling the desk work.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: I've been saying this for some time now, but don't try to take on everything. Now that Zofia and Maria aren't around, how are you supposed to deal with all this?
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Yeah, thanks for worrying about me. It's true that there is much I can't handle. All I can do is deal with what I can.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Perhaps it's because I've been away from Kazimierz for too long, or perhaps I just never knew much about the city's rules in the first place.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: And now that I must live with these rules for the foreseeable future, I finally realize how little I understood.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Sometimes, I even think that... From what I remember of my time in Kazimierz before my exile, all I ever did was take Grandfather's hand, follow him, and watch the scenery from that safe road.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: If I may ask once again, what happened during the years I was away?
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Ah, what a coincidence. Fancy running into you again, Sir MÅ‚ynar.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: You commissioned the bounty hunters and disappeared just as quickly. That kind of behavior gets you blacklisted, you know.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...Do you need something?
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Me? I'm just here to take a look at the village. After all, the villagers did send us a message asking for help.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The construction team was supposed to start work today, but now that Gale Industries is under investigation, the land sale has been called off. Or so I hear.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...I do read the papers.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Oh, then I'm sure you've also read that the investigation dragged in quite a number of other companies and old noble families. The National Council even dug up a certain old case from a few years ago, all thanks to this.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The ones who took the blame back then are long gone, and not a lot of people still remember how it all went down.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But I'm sure you do?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: If they're no longer around, is there really a point in celebrating this?
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: I suppose you're right. I'm sure our good noble knight wouldn't consider those men even worth taking revenge on.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: As for us lowly bounty hunters... All we did is help pass the evidence from one pair of hands to another. Nothing worth paying any mind to.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But now that everything's been taken care of and the dust has settled... We go pretty far back, right? I think I've earned the right to ask a few questions?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: If it's about Czcibor, I have nothing to say.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Right... I think we both need some time to ourselves. If you still need to mull this over, I shan't bother you.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But I'm sure you know how I managed to find you.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: All I'm saying is... I have nothing to say.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: If you're really that curious... He was an unwavering man who rambled on about his impossible ideals for the knighthood, right to the very end.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: And if you think this deserves mourning... suit yourself.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Hah, from the sounds of it, that was quite the cruel final conversation.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But since you brought it up, I suppose it's not so bad to talk about it a little.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I remember there was this one time I ran into that self-taught medic of ours. He was with a heavily injured comrade of his, lying on the ground. So he picked up a weapon and sent his friend on his way.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I have no idea what they talked about. All I could see was that he was covered in blood and looked pretty uncomfortable. He must have been depressed, or so I thought.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But do you know what he said after that?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: He told me the blood was too hot.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: It might actually be a pretty nice way to go, thinking everything's looking hopeful and that your ideals are about to come true.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Alas, if at the very end you're still only talking ideals, you probably aren't dying with your mind at ease. You could still probably make everyone else feel burnt, though.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Burnt?...Given the biased ideals he chose in his depression and anger, I have no sympathy for a tragic end.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: His doubts don't even compare to everything I've pondered over the years.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: If you wanted to find out what drove him to such extremes, be it pain or ambition, then I'm afraid you'll be disappointed.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Really? What a shame.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Surely you've seen enough men stray onto the wrong path?
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: A few years back, we had a small skirmish with another band of hunters in this area. He lent us a helping hand. Or rather, he chased away both sides.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: A campaign knight who'd choose to go on patrol all over the place on his own... Quite interesting, wouldn't you agree? At the very least, I'd say he was a stronger man than a certain noble scion who was working an office job in the Grand Knight Territory.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: This isn't the time for your jokes, Toland.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Hah, don't be so serious.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I even heard that, after this whole conspiracy was exposed, some of the Infected workmen were given protection in secret, sparing them from becoming needless sacrifices in the political struggle's aftermath.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: â€”And well, I found you through them.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: What do you think now, MÅ‚ynar?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: It's been years.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.text: A knight should not remain forever in doubt. He should have an answer that he firmly believes in.

attributes.content: ...I've never had an answer.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Kazimierz does not need an answer from me, either.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: I'm an ordinary man, nothing more. Why ask me?
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Then perhaps... you should think about doing something other than holing yourself up in the Grand Knight Territory again.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: You can't keep blaming yourself for his death, much less go this far to atone for it.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: â€”Excuse me, are you two tourists?
attributes.name: Eager Bartender

attributes.content: Our beer is known far and wide, so would each of you like to try a pint? You may, of course, drink outside if you'd like.
attributes.name: Eager Bartender

attributes.content: No thanks. Weather's getting cold.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...Too bad. I only turned her down because of how dreary drinking by myself would be. Otherwise, I could really use some booze to lighten things up.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: If only Czcibor had behaved himself for just a couple more days, we could've had a blast at our reunion party.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: That way, you could've kept a clear head and stayed out of it. No one would've blamed you for it.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...I never said I'd stand aside and do nothing.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: However, I was the one who refuted his ideals. I listened to him until the very end...
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: ...and I killed him.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: But I... I respect his life nonetheless. If only for his final question and nothing more, I must find an answer.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: I visited Grandfather's grave this morning.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: I thought about a lot of things as I stood there. My regrets about the past... and for certain things in the present.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: I really wish I could still talk to him, tell him about all this, seek his advice, but all I could do was say my farewells after such a long absence.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: ...It hadn't sunk in until after I'd finished all my work last night and set down my pen. He truly isn't with us anymore. I didn't have to keep my voice down so as not to disturb him.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Gah, don't blame yourself, Margaret.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: We all know you couldn't have made it back, nor should you have.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Nonetheless, I still feel terrible for not being able to stay by my grandfather's side, or to hear his final wishes.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: ...Maria told me that he sent a Messenger for me from his deathbed.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Huh. Now that you mention it, yeah.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: But Kirill seemed even happier when the Messenger told him she couldn't reach you. After all, if a Messenger can't find you, then an assassin sure as hell can't.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: He told us himself that he'd rather the children of the Nearl family grow up elsewhere, instead of Kazimierz as it is now.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: At the very least, I'm sure he'd be more than satisfied if he could see you now.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Thanks...
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: So, how was the family after Grandfather passed away?
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Not gonna lie, some folks still have it out for the Nearls. Even the Messenger he sent after you got shot by an arrow not long after she got back. She had to hide out here for a while.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: *Spit*. Just a bunch of cowards who've only got the balls to ambush a Messenger. If someone really dared to pick a fight with the Nearls, we wouldn't just sit on the sidelines and watch.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: I should've realized sooner that this sort of thing could happen. Only Grandfather's reputation was shielding us from these attacks, covert and otherwise.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Actually, I was threatened too, not long ago.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Who's got the balls to pick a fight with you?!
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Oh, no, not me directly. A friend that I had recently met at a welfare event was injured. I only found out afterward.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Apparently my speech offended some members of the G.C.C. They sent an anonymous letter warning me to be more careful about what I say.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: But I understand that this didn't happen because of a single speech or turn of phrase. It's more likely that they simply used that as an excuse.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Perhaps such attacks will happen again and again, until I'm made to cower and stop being a thorn in their side.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Of course, I don't plan to let that happen. I will keep fighting, and do everything in my power to protect others. I just thought you should know.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: It's just like the Major. It's only thanks to the support of my friends that I could finish the competition.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Eh, why even mention it? Can't we at least help the Nearls out in their time of need? Besides, not a single one of the folks that came looking for trouble knew how to fight if their lives depended on it.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Don't forget to come to us for help just because you're too busy with work.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Thanks for always being there for us, everyone.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Aw, our little Margaret is starting to act more and more like a real Knight Primus.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: No, I've only just gotten back to Kazimierz. There are still so many responsibilities I must shoulder, but don't fully understand.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Right, Margaret, you're Rhodes Island's liaison with Kazimierz. They take care of quite a few Infected, don't they?
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Are the Infected and medical personnel there part of those responsibilities too?
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Oh, there is nothing to worry about on that end. Rhodes Island has attempted aid in places where their status is even more complicated than it is here. They know how to navigate these societal pitfalls much better than me.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: That said... There are quite a lot of Infected who don't want to go through with the treatment, and that's actually our biggest problem.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Hm... Because of money?
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Right. The emergency treatment that they provide is only temporary. To continue to suppress the Oripathy's growth, you have to keep buying medicine in the long term.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: The way Kazimierz is now, there's no path for the Infected other than becoming a knight. Some will never be able to afford the cost of ongoing treatment.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: There are also many who think Rhodes Island is just trying to squeeze money out of them. After all, it is an incurable disease.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: â€”Sorry for rambling, I always get carried away whenever I talk about the Infected.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Well, you've got no one to vent to at home. If you need someone to talk to, you could do worse than us.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Besides, hearing you worry about all that stuff really brings it home that you're an adult now.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Haha... Master Kowal, do you remember my parents' portrait we have in the hall at home? The one from their younger years?
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: I only noticed this just yesterday, but I look almost the same age now as they do in that painting.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Hah? Well, when you put it that way, time sure has flown by.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Right, I feel the same, and that's one of the reasons why I wanted to stop by today.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: I remember back when my parents had just left. I had just learned to read well enough to take in a whole novel.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Back then, looking at the illustrations in those knightly legends, I always thought the female leads were drawn based on Mother.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: But what kind of knights were they, anyway? When they left, I wasn't even old enough to seriously spar with Father in the training grounds.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: And once, during a duel, Uncle Liam told me I resembled my father...
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: That punk Schnitz, huh...?
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Back when I was still a campaign knight, I'd never seen a young man better suited for the word 'talented.'
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Even setting aside being Kirill's oldest son, he was unstoppable. Legends about him were already spreading like wildfire when he was still a squire...
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Sorry, I have a phone call.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: ...Negotiate which occasions call for deploying the Infected diagnosis technology? Very well, I'll pass it on and make the preparations.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Sounds like the Radiant Knight is busy.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: I'm sorry. I was hoping to stay a little longer.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Go on now. Us old folks aren't going anywhere.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Hmph, I'm still thinking about the Nearls. It's been a while since anyone's mentioned Schnitz.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: It's too bad. He could've gone down in Kazimierzian history as a hero like his father. Hell, he should've.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Right. I just never thought a bright light like his would turn out to be a brief spark on the battlefield.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Remember how we were launching a counterattack on the fortress at the easternmost point of the battlefront? And there was a squad that cut off Ursus's first wave of reinforcements?
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Hah, how could I forget? Back then, I really thought the two of them would stand side-by-side on the battlefield as leaders of the campaign knights in only a few more years.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: I remember I was planning on sticking around until both the Nearl young'uns had made a name for themselves.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Who would've thought that by the time we finally left the battlefield, there wouldn't be any Nearls in the campaign knights.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: *Sigh*... And that punk MÅ‚ynar left of his own volition.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Well, it's not like he led a real knightclub.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Schnitz wanted to include them in the operation, but the other knightclubs pushed back, and MÅ‚ynar just didn't want his friends bullied.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: ...'How could a bunch of refugees who simply want to break through the fortress and return to their homelands possibly compare to us knights?'
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Speaking of, where did that punk run off to? I should've asked Margaret just now.
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: If she didn't bring it up, he probably hasn't written back yet.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: He used to leave home for months or years at a time, didn't he? Don't worry about him. Margaret's here to take care of the family. Things'll get better, slowly but surely.
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: ...I won't ask what you two talked about in the end.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: You made your decision.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But if you told me that there's no longer a place for knights in Kazimierz, I suppose I wouldn't disagree.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The vast majority of folks prefer the performers in the arenas, who can help them forget their hardships, over a knight who can actually shatter their suffering.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I mean, they don't actually want to see their lives shattered. It's a waste of time and effort. Besides, putting up a struggle till the very end rarely ends well.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...He understood that, no doubt.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: I'm sure he did. And both of us have known that for a long time now, too. He simply chose... to bang his head on the past, straight-on.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Well, well. We said give us some peace and quiet to think on things...
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Not that either of us will ever have peace again.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.text: A fowlbeast cries out. It is a unique cry, one that can only be heard before the coming of winter.
On hearing it, one thinks back to years past, to the fresh snow they tread upon and the frost on their weapons.
Though it was but a single snowflake silently falling into the abyss, they heard the long, roaring echo of the winter

attributes.content: That said... sometimes I think, hey, even a good-for-nothing like me can do some good and rescue folks.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: So who exactly are these 'vast majority of folks' we're blaming here?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: When you look at it that way, maybe it's not all that disgraceful to be just an ordinary person.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Besides, he returned the sword to you.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...There's no place for such a sharp weapon in today's Kazimierz.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: He needn't have gone through the trouble.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.text: Returning to their small huts in the corner of the village, the repatriated Infected workmen quietly walk past two neighbors who are discussing how to work together to collect the resources they need to make it through the winter.
Both the white haze of their breaths and the smoke from their kitchens slowly dissipate in the breeze.
They will never again wonder where they would spend the winter should the construction team arrive.

attributes.content: Speaking of which... Pinus Sylvestris asked me to pass on this letter of invitation to you.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...From Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: They may be a foreign company, but you're already pretty familiar with them, aren't you?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I know you aren't too interested in their particular business... but you should keep the letter.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: They actually helped us out a little when we pulled our little kidnapping stunt.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The business permit I got from them definitely came in handy, not to mention the combat support from the young Pinus girls. I really owe them a huge favor.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Now, while you know I'd love for you to join me, alas, I get the impression you haven't changed your mind. So I might as well repay that favor now.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Besides, my guess is that their 'Doctor' must've told you something... About your brother and his wife.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Maybe a message from the Grand Knight? Perhaps Rossi's intention was to drop Margaret a hint, and in the end our favorite negotiator chose to pass the word on to you?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Even when speculating, you should know there are lines you shouldn't cross.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Hah, let me have my fun.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: So you plan to keep looking? Even though there hasn't been any news of them whatsoever?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...I have no reason to abandon hope.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Even if that hope is baseless?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: It's more than enough.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: ...I was in the Grand Knight Territory for ten years, and all the hope I had those ten long years does not even compare to this hope.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Rather, only someone extremely childish would be satisfied with their life, this era... and themselves.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: Well, ain't that the truth.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Speaking of which, somehow I doubt you've written to Margaret lately.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Do I need to? She's more than capable of taking responsibility for the trouble she invites.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: But what if the problems she runs into are ones you've dealt with before? Shouldn't you step up, as her guardian?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: She should be following her own path, not mine.
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar

attributes.content: So, where will you go now?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Excuse me, sirs?
attributes.name: Young Male Driver

attributes.content: Would you happen know where Dzwonek is at the moment? Is this the right way?
attributes.name: Young Male Driver

attributes.content: Huh? You don't know? I see, I guess I'll keep driving and find out.
attributes.name: Young Male Driver

attributes.content: I don't wanna sit in the car anymoreâ€”
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: We're almost there, sweetie. Just sit tight a little while longer. Daddy will get you a piccolo, okay?
attributes.name: Young Male Driver

attributes.content: You can't buy hand-crafted Leithanian instruments anywhere else.
attributes.name: Young Male Driver

attributes.text: He remembers practically every road there is, but not one of them points at a city that
All roads have their destinations set in stone. What he seeks lies beyond any road.

attributes.content: ...If a man is but a lost wanderer, what does it matter where he is, or where he's heading?
attributes.name: MÅ‚ynar
